newsitem.title: USA: Kingston Metal, Swedform enter joint venture.
newsitem.headline: Kingston Metal, Swedform enter joint venture.

text.p: Kingston Metal Corp said on Monday it has entered a sales and manufacturing joint venture with Sweden's Swedform AB.

Under the terms of the joint venture, the combined capabilities of Kingston and Swedform will include six plant locations, nearly 1 million square feet of manufacturing space and revenues approaching $150 million, the company said.
Both companies make and finish sheet metal and perform electromechanical assembly for telecommunications, electronics and computer industries, Kingston said.

Kingston Metal said the alliance will allow both companies to offer enhanced engineering and development and manufacturing capabilities for customers, participate in joint purchasing strategies and to share technology and manufacturing processes.
The joint venture will allow both companies to solidify their presence in Europe and North America and expand the companies into Mexico, China, Southeast Asia and Brazil, Kingston said.
Together Kingston and Swedform employ nearly 800 workers in plants in Luzerne and Kingston, Pennsylvania; Columbia, South Carolina; Skillingaryd, Vaggeryd and Lovisjo, Sweden.
